definition: poetic essay/taxation/to bestow on/to endow with

sentences.english: Everyone grumbled at the imposition of new taxes.
sentences.chinese: 对征收新加的赋税人人都抱怨。

sentences.english: The entire “Korean wave” is manufactured through subsidies and tax breaks.
sentences.chinese: 整个“韩流”是建立在政府补贴和赋税减免的基础上。

sentences.english: Soochow levy taxes can be seen, there are households and household sub-sub-Pin Zhi Mishina like minutes.
sentences.chinese: 可见东吴征收赋税，确有户分三品与户分九品之类分。

sentences.english: Fenghuangshan bamboo slips are the important tax information of the Han Dynasty .
sentences.chinese: 凤凰山汉简是研究汉代赋税的重要资料。

sentences.english: A pollution sin tax could also offset current taxes, such as income tax.
sentences.chinese: 环境罪恶税也可抵消当期赋税，不如说所得税。

sentences.english: Production of these half-size packs can also help to circumvent the effects of increased taxation on cigarettes.
sentences.chinese: 生产这种半量包装的香烟有助于香烟上赋税的问题。

sentences.english: The land-tax system is one of important items in Xinjiang's taxation during the Qing dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 田赋制度是清代新疆赋税制度的重要内容之一。

sentences.english: Sweden's tax-benefit system cuts its poverty rate by 80%.
sentences.chinese: 瑞典的赋税优惠体系将其贫困率减少了80%。

sentences.english: I want to see permanency in the [U.S.] tax code.
sentences.chinese: 对于美国的问题，我想要看到永久性的赋税方案。

sentences.english: The people groaned under the load of taxes.
sentences.chinese: 人民在赋税的重压下受折磨。

sentences.english: Ultimately US taxes will be higher.
sentences.chinese: 最终美国的赋税将会增加。

sentences.english: Engels once compared taxes to the wet nurse of the government.
sentences.chinese: 恩格斯曾把赋税比作政府的乳娘。

sentences.english: The source of heavy taxes in Roman Empire can be traced back to the beginning of building tax-system.
sentences.chinese: 罗马帝国赋税苛重的根源应追溯到建立税制之初。

definition: taxation/in former times, esp. land tax
land tax/money and grain (given as tax or tribute)
government revenue/tributary goods and finances/finances and taxes/wealth/property/belongings
to let sb off (punishment, taxation etc)/to reprieve sb
